attributes.action: Take Pitbulls off the 1991 dangerous dog act.
attributes.background: Any dog can be dangerous, IF IT IS RAISED INCORRECTLY. Pitbulls shouldn’t be banned. It’s the owners fault for wrongly raising the dogs and action should be taken on owners and not the dogs.

attributes.action: Free Sanitary products for women and girls on benefits
attributes.background: Read a homeless lady on Tube crying and asking fellow passengers if any had spare Tampons or Pads ; if chaps had to use them bet they would be FOC

attributes.action: All foods that contain gelatine must state what type of animal it is made from
attributes.background: I would like this to happen as many religions have certain foods that they are not allowed to eat.
attributes.additional_details:
Reading the ingredients on the back of food to check and it just says gelatine is not helpful. This petition is simple and wants companies to be required to specify what animal gelatine is in their products.

I really hope we can do this as a United Kingdom and bring together at least 10,000 signatures so we can get a written response from the Government!

attributes.action: Allow the disabled access to biodegradable single use plastics in any future ban
attributes.background: There has been a considerable number of concerns raised by the disabled community and allies about the need for single use plastics in their lives. I would like the language of any ban on any single use plastics to include an exemption for biodegradable plastics for the disabled community.

attributes.action: have Tinnitus retraining therapy in all UK hospitals
attributes.background: about 1 in every 5 people in the UK suffer from Tinnitus and having Tinnitus retrainning therapy in a hospital closer to their house will help them.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to feed and encourage seagulls to nest
attributes.background: The spiralling number of seagulls in our cities and surrounding suburbs are adversely impacting the mental well-being of residents. Their incessant screeching starts in earnest in the early hours and persists for much of the day. They defecate on property, vehicles and washing and attract vermin
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/weird-news/residents-declare-war-seagulls-poisoned-6098194
http://www.worcesternews.co.uk/news/13581245.New_crackdown_drawn_up_to_tackle__aggressive__seagulls_in_Worcester/
https://www.economist.com/britain/2017/02/09/britains-war-on-seagulls
https://www.fixmystreet.com/report/26682
https://www.theedinburghreporter.co.uk/2017/02/morningside-councillor-wants-council-to-get-rid-of-gulls/

attributes.action: Mandate HMRC to say 'thank you' to small businesses
attributes.background: UK Entrepreneurs have started 5.7 million small businesses & employ more than 16 million people. Since 2010 alone they have created 2 million jobs. The blood, sweat and tears of these entrepreneurs goes unnoticed by HMRC, despite the huge tax contribution to the UK Govt. Just say thank you.
attributes.additional_details: Small business owners’ tax returns should say thank you for the VAT, the PAYE, the Employers NI and the Corporation Tax. This would recognise the risks they have taken to start their companies – as well as the sleepless nights, the sports days missed and the birthdays forgotten- and the contribution they make creating employment and contributing to our economy.

attributes.action: Abolish the 3 types of civil restraining orders.
attributes.background: Many victims who pick up the courage to sue the perpetrators in civil courts often end up with one of the three types of Civil Restraining Orders, which prevents them from seeking justice in the courts. Such orders are unacceptable in a civilised democratic society.
attributes.additional_details: Civil Restraining Orders (CRO) were created without public consultations or parliamentary debates. CRO effectively bans victims from seeking justice, is easily given by judges and there is no appeal to a different judge. This is profound as such serious "gagging orders" and "bans" should not be allowed in any civilised democratic society, especially since the UK has the most prominent profile on human rights and equality. It is every citizen's right to sue if she/he has exhausted other avenues.

attributes.action: I believe that it should be mandatory for ALL lunch breaks to be paid.
attributes.background: As of right now, when working on the minimum wage, the employee will lose either £36.90 or £39.15 each week, depending on age group. This is roughly £147.60 or £156.60 lost each month. In my opinion, this is outrageous; ultimately feeling like being punished for needing to eat and rest.

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 13!!!
attributes.background: Teenagers should be allowed the right to vote. They are old enough to understand current world affairs and still young enough to be affected by it later on in their lives. They should be able to have a voice and decide their own future.

attributes.action: Increase funding for local councils to tackle homelessness.
attributes.background: Poverty in general is a prevalent issue in the UK; homelessness rates have been significantly increasing; why is the government's form of action evidently not working, if there is any?

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to allow Northern England to claim independence.
attributes.background: Northern England is always the most underfunded out of everywhere in the UK. We in northern England pay taxes, yet it is always the south that spends it. We have the worst public transport system in the UK, and many other services including the NHS receive the smallest amount of funding in England.
attributes.additional_details:
Northern England should be allowed to hold a referendum on whether we should claim independence from England and form our own country within the UK.

Northern England is always forgotten about in the south including Downing Street. The government does not fund or maintain northern England properly as it should. 

We in northern England pay taxes, yet the south spends it. It is time to hold a referendum in Northern England !

attributes.action: Cap Tax Avoidance - Introduce 1% Minimum Corporation Tax based on Turnover
attributes.background: It is not unreasonable to expect that all companies who wish to participate in the UK economy should be treated fairly and equally under the tax legislation.  The minimum corporation tax rate based on turnover should be the mechanism to ensure that this happens.
attributes.additional_details:
The minimum corporation tax can be collected in advance at the point of sales and/or assessed annually based on reported turnover.   The new tax could easily be extended in the future to include all cypto-currency transactions to ensure the tax compliance.

On average, the FTSE 100 companies’ corporation tax expense to turnover has gone from 4% to 1% over the last 5 years and companies like eBay pay even less with 0.2% of their turnover going to the UK Tax-man!

attributes.action: Raise parent earning limit from individual to joint to enable equal childcare
attributes.background:
Government will provide 30hours a week free childcare. 1 condition is if an individual earns <£100k. 2 parents both earning <£100k can far exceed the gross income of a family where only 1 individual earns £100k+ e.g. £95k+£60k.

Petition is to enable £200k joint before family no longer qualifies.
attributes.additional_details:
Family A 
- Parent 1 £99k 
- Parent 2 £99k 
- Total = £198k 
- Household allowed 30 hours free child care

Family B 
- Parent 1 £101k 
- Parent 2 £15k 
- Total = £116k 
- Household is NOT entitled to free childcare (despite gross income £82k less!)
- Petition to ALLOW this type of scenario to qualify for free child care

This petition will enable Family B parent 2 to increase working hours by accessing equal childcare funding.

attributes.action: Increase research and funding into Lyme Diease and co-infections
attributes.background: Lyme Diease and co-infections is a serious infection that isn't being treated correctly by the NICE guidelines please sign this to force the research and funding into this infection and strength the NHS to treat this debilitating Diease
attributes.additional_details: Lyme is becoming more and more reported in the UK and all over the world, case numbers are getting higher. After i become infected i found the treatement given in the UK was not enough and i keep relapsing, because of this ive been forced to go private to get the right treatment we need a cure not symtom management !!

attributes.action: Make compassionate leave a Statutory Right With Reasonable Period off & full pay
attributes.background: compassionate leave is not offered in my contract, I researched this online and found that this is not a statutory right. If like me you work on commission and earn a low salary you will struggle financially in an emergency, I think this needs to change and people should have the right to grieve.
attributes.additional_details:
My wife's grandmother died and we had to fly to get to the funeral, upon my return I was told that I would need to use my 5 of my holiday days (I only get 20) as they didn't offer compassionate leave. I thought this was unfair and I feel that this needs to change and should be a basic right. 

gov.uk website 
"pay, your employer may pay you for time off to look after dependents but they don't have to. check your contact, company handbook or internet site to see if there are rules about this. "

attributes.action: Renationalise all rail as they do not care for the consumer at all.
attributes.background: The new timetable that has been released has been a complete mess as their have been hunders of cancellations in peak times. They have removed services to blatantly avoid paying delay repay. Its abhorrent they get away with this and its about time the rail companies became publically owned.
attributes.additional_details: Check any timetable and you'll see the amount of services cancelled daily.

attributes.action: Do not ban 'cartoon characters' from 'unhealthy foods'.
attributes.background: MPs on the Health Committee wish to ban cartoon characters on 'unhealthy food' (such as Tony the Tiger & Nestle's Milky Bar Kid). These brand mascots have been around for decades yet obesity rates are only very high now due to bad parenting.
attributes.additional_details: Link to BBC Article - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-44298135

attributes.action: Provide armed security for the Orthodox Jewish Community in the UK
attributes.background: European governments are providing armed security for synagogues and Jewish institutions following numerous fatal terror attacks. This is because where there is a serious risk of fatalities, the only feasible solution is to provide armed security for Jewish public places. The UK must do the same.
attributes.additional_details:
The Terror threat level in Europe is getting worse, with innocent people of all races being murdered. The threat to the Jewish community is always greater, in particular when elements of the media promote anti-semitic perspectives on the Middle East conflict. The Gov't Provides armed Police for Foreign embassies and must do the same for it's own citizens who need it.

It is impossible for a policeman or security guard without a weapon to protect sites from  terrorists armed with weapons.

attributes.action: Make Government Funds Available for Victims & Families of Terrorist Attacks
attributes.background:
I was shocked to recently learn that there is ‘No’ financial funding help for victims or their families of terrorist attacks in the U.K. 
In light of the Manchester Arena bombing, and the 22 victims, London Bridge Attack, Westminster Attack, Finsbury Park Attack in 2017 we should be helping.
attributes.additional_details:
Financial Funds need to be made available for victims and their families , and those who have been affected by incidents of terrorism in the United Kingdom. There needs to be a special fund set up to help these people, and their families who need to take time off work, to look after family members, general living expenses, and specialist care.
This is the least we can do as a nation, to help people who need it the most. After experiencing such life affecting atrocities!

attributes.action: Grants for wash/dry toilets installed in households. Stop use of wipes/tissue.
attributes.background: There is currently a lot  in the media about how harmful the use of toilet wipes is on the environment and marine life. It is also costly to clear up and provide necessary protection. Providing access to grant aided/discounted wash and dry toilets should help to greatly minimise this. SaveOurPlanet!

attributes.action: Decriminalise drug possession
attributes.background: People are currently being needlessly prosecuted for consuming drugs. This method has proved innefective in curbing drug use and deaths. By decriminalising drug possession we can save millions of pounds on convictions and invest in harm reduction methods and education as shown effective by Portugal.
attributes.additional_details: As shown by this link https://www.statista.com/chart/10320/drug-deaths-in-europe/ Portugal's system of decriminalisation has resulted in the lowest death rate from drugs if any country in Europe. By decriminalising drug possession users and addicts alike can get help to stop their addiction and use drugs in a safer manner. Moreover, the majority of drug users do not pose a threat to society and their lives are being ruined due to unjust drug laws. We help the disabled, why not drug users?

attributes.action: Give public vote on brexit either to accept the deal or leave with a no deal
attributes.background: We have voted to leave in a fair and democratic vote, we now need to vote on whether we agree with the governments deal to leave the EU or do we want to leave with a no deal

attributes.action: Allow cannabis oil to be prescribed for terminally ill cancer patients
attributes.background: The UK has recently approved medical cannabis oil on the NHS but not for terminal cancer patients. All terminal cancer suffers should be able to receive cannabis oil. Please sign this petition and let's give these suffers hope of a more fulfilled life.

attributes.action: Recognise in DWP assessments that depression and anxiety are debilitating
attributes.background: I suffer severe depression and anxiety, yet the DWP deem me to be fit for work. I have been refused every benefit I've applied for based on a medical assessment in 2015. I'm certain there are thousands of others in similar positions.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should ensure medical assessments recognise the impact of these illness when assessing peoples’ fitness to work.

attributes.action: Allow first time buyers to use their pension savings as a deposit for mortgage
attributes.background: It is very difficult to save up the money and sometimes unrealistic.

attributes.action: Make standard code of practice for safety in soft play & indoor play mandatory
attributes.background: As a parent of 3 children,I know just how popular soft play centres can be for families. With UK weather, they are often needed as fair weather place for children to play. Just as the amount of centres in the UK increase, so do the amount of incidents including harm to children. Regulation is needed
attributes.additional_details:
There are many cases that have been reported in the news of incidents at soft play, which include:
Accidents:
https://www.netmums.com/coffeehouse/being-mum-794/children-4-11-years-60/759544-soft-play-centres-accidents.html
Bullying & Harm:
https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/whats-on/family-kids/mum-bullied-abused-playcentre-having-2029547
Food Hygeine
https://www.gazettelive.co.uk/news/teesside-news/investigation-play-factory-vomiting-outbreak-14443979

attributes.action: Fund 12yr olds to visit Menin Gate &15yr olds to visit Auschwitz and Birkenau.
attributes.background: The rise of anti Semitism & apparent devaluing of the armed forces & their role in maintaining our democracy, there are lessons to be learnt by young people ACTUALLY seeing the scale of the horror & to establish a connection between them & the sacrifice and values that helped create modern Britain.
attributes.additional_details: I learned about World Wars at school and read about Hitler and the Nazis subsequently. I visited the Meningate and war graves in France and Belgium and paid my respects. But I did not envisage the profound reaction that a recent visit to Auschwitz and Birkenau had on my husband, friends and me. The industrial scale of the genocide was evident before our eyes. Lectures and books cannot fully capture the scale. The past MUST not be forgotten.

attributes.action: Abolish faith schools
attributes.background: Children under no circumstance should be submitted to education in religious schools. We should encourage future generations to have an academic mindset free from religious belief.
attributes.additional_details: Religion is a choice that should be made in adulthood and not influenced and preached onto young growing minds.

attributes.action: To make Party political Manifestos legally binding once elected.
attributes.background: Parties of all political persuasions have attempted to gain votes  by making headline gestures that they can save millions, they then renege on this pledge. This petition is trying to seek full transparency on manifestos and exactly how they will be implemented by financially backing their claims.
attributes.additional_details: Whether its student fees, the NHS, Police, immigration or universal credit. This debate should it happen will focus all political parties to sound out financial and political options; before making manifesto statements. This will show that the parties are 100% certain that they can implement and fully back up their claims. Additionally a penalty system would need to be proposed for those who do not carry out the manifesto pledge are duly summoned to public recourse and/or financial penalty.

attributes.action: universal credit to pay rent cost during the 4week period before first payment
attributes.background: Universal credit is causing a big problem for people falling into rent arrears at the beginning the claim by making the claimant have to wait an initial period of 4-5 weeks before issuing the first Payment in which rent arrears are building up and already people are at risk of Losing their homes.
attributes.additional_details: There used to be help for when people returned to work by giving a grace period of 1 months extra housing benefit to help with the transition from jobseekers allowance to work before the housing benefit was cancelled. Could something like this be actioned?  especially when you are moving people from an old existing benefit into the new umbrella of universal credit and rent arrears will have started accumulating. Was this 4-5wk period never thought about?! and the awful knock on effect to follow?

attributes.action: Make it an Offence Outside London to Park on Footpaths.
attributes.background: The issues caused by Vehicles parking on Footpaths is General and Not just London, causes Issues with the Disabled Scooters, the Blind, Pushchairs and the Elderly, Vehicles on Footpaths also Cause Damage to the Footpaths costing the Councils Money and the Tax payer
attributes.additional_details:
Footpaths are as in the Name for People on Foot Only for Safety Issues and Children not having to go out into the Road to get by some who do Not care as long as they do not have to walk far.

Parking on footpaths should be illegal outside London as well as inside. Should have never happened that London appears to be Separate from all other Cities and Towns.

attributes.action: Scrap free television licences for the over-75s
attributes.background: According to Lord Hall of Birkenhead, the over-75s consume many more BBC services than others, yet are not required to pay for a television licence. This means households that are not eligible for a free licence are being forced to subsidise the over-75s which amounts to age discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: According to TV Licensing there were 4,455,000 over-75s licences in force in 2017. At the current cost of £150.50 per licence, this represents a total cost of £670 million that is covered by households that pay for a television licence.

attributes.action: Lower the tax for fuel so it’s more affordable
attributes.background: The fuel prices in the uk are reaching an all time high, other country’s pay way less on fuel! This needs to be actioned now !

attributes.action: Introduce conjugal visits in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: In many other countries conjugal visits are permitted. However, in the U.K. it is not permitted. the biggest advantages of allowing conjugal visits is prisoners tend to follow the rules for fear of losing their right to have a visit. Moreover, the biggest advantage is families no longer suffer.
attributes.additional_details: Conjugal visits are allowed in Australia, Brazil, Canada, Denmark, Germany, india, Israel, Mexico, Russia, Saudi Arabia, and Spain. In the US, conjugal visits are not allowed in Federal prisons, but California, New York, Mississippi, Washington, and Connecticut permit them.

attributes.action: UK to impose sanctions on Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: The world is in shock of the brutality of Saudi Arabia's politicians!

attributes.action: All consumables, must by law have a biodegradable time scale stated them.
attributes.background: If for example "Bio 1mo" or "Bio 600yr" had to be printed or stamped on consumables by law.  Making consumers see how long their item will take to biodegrade may make ppl think twice. Biodegradable is a misinterpreted word, by stating actual time scales consumers can make an informed decision.
attributes.additional_details: We are killing our planet, slowly suffocating it. People still do not like to be told what to do, by putting the ball back in their hands, letting them make the choice by actually seeing what effect their lifestyle has in real time may make ppl think more and make better chioces.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for Supermarkets to give all leftover produce to homeless
attributes.background: The amount of food waste by Supermarket’s in the UK stands at 1.9 million tonnes and that is simply sickening when there are 8 million people living in food poverty today.

attributes.action: Stop the bedroom tax and stop homelessness increasing.
attributes.background:
The government should stop the bedroom tax and help the vulnerable on
limited budgets. Homelessness is on the increase and this tax is helping
towards those figures due to people not been able to pay for the rent shortfall out of their limited benefits.
attributes.additional_details: With the universal credits system taking 6 weeks before getting paid, the bedroom tax is another expense that people are struggling with and making people homeless.

attributes.action: Make dentist check ups and all necessary treatments free on the NHS
attributes.background: If I go to a doctor for a check up or with a problem it doesn't cost me anything. Yet if I go to the dentist I have to pay. If I break my arm or need an operation I don't need to pay for it. If I break my tooth or need something done to my teeth I need to pay.
attributes.additional_details: I work hard and pay my national insurance. I should not need to pay for NHS dentists. If I received certain benefits I could get the dentist for free, but as always regular hard working people of the country who don’t qualify for benefits have to pay for everything. Your teeth are important, it's part of your health and can cause major problems if there is something wrong. Nobody should not need to pay to be seen or treated by a dentist on the NHS!

attributes.action: Make it illegal to leave children under 13 home alone
attributes.background: There is currently no age restriction for a child being given the responsibility of staying at home alone as long as it’s not overnight and that isn’t “in a manner likely to cause unnecessary suffering or injury to health”.
attributes.additional_details:
This is NOT right, there are a range of issues including safeguarding of children. As parents and carers we have a duty to our children.

The petition is aimed to try to implement a law that states that no child under the age of 13 should be left alone at any given time, the reason for this is due to safeguarding and putting a huge responsibility on children regardless of their mental age. We are not allowed to leave children alone overnight and the same rules must apply throughout the day too. I understand a child must be given due responsibility but under the age of 13 should not be allowed due to risks and safety.

attributes.action: Make the NHS exempt from paying business rates.
attributes.background: NHS Hospitals are facing rising business rates whilst private hospitals are able to register as a charity saving them around 80% on their business rates.

attributes.action: End Equal Opportunities Question about your race when applying for jobs
attributes.background: When applying for a job vacancies in the UK the employer always state that they are an equal opportunity employer and  you are required to state your ethnic minority group. Now this give the employer the opertunity discriminate against prospective employees the election  process.
attributes.additional_details: People from ethnic minority groups are being discriminate against whilst applying for job vacancy online In the pre selection process by employer. The question about stating what ethnic minority group you are from should be omitted from online application forms all together. If you are applying for a job that you are qualified for the question about your race shouldn't be of importance to the employer for selection. I applied for the same job with the same details but change my race from one to next and recieve a call the following day.

attributes.action: Make CCTV mandatory on streets where crime doubles in 6 months.
attributes.background: Hotspots of escalating crime figures are indications of organised crime where false reporting and framing of individuals for crimes they didnt commit can become more likely. CCTV is advisable on streets where crime figures double in 6 months
attributes.additional_details: Sign the petition and change the law so CCTV stops gangs lying to the police

attributes.action: Hold a referendum for devolution in the North of England.
attributes.background: In 2004 the North East of England had a devolution referendum. Due to the small turnout the same referendum for the North West of England was never held. It is the opinion of many that the socio-economic divide between the North and the South of England has grown exponentially over the past decade.
attributes.additional_details: With growing cases of the North not having their issues and needs fairly addressed in the Southern biased Parliament, it is time that a referendum is held to offer those citizens North of the River Trent an opportunity to vote on devolution. This will provide a platform for issues relevant to the North of England to be considered without an underlying London-centricity.

attributes.action: Bring in a recognised standard of safety for installation of blinds.
attributes.background: For years the blind industry has the good and the bad installers, which is the same in a lot of industries but this can be the case of life or death when cords are involved.
attributes.additional_details: There are many cases of children losing their lives to poorly installed blinds due to the cording.

attributes.action: Introduce official national ID cards or make PASS cards part of the law
attributes.background: Many people lose their IDs such as driving license which is difficult and costly to replace.PASS hologram cards supposedly should fix this problem but until this day not every place recognises this type of identification.We need the government to introduce something that would be recognisable fully
attributes.additional_details: PASS hologram cards don’t work everywhere from my experience as many places like nightclubs are not even aware of them and usually they reject people that have them. What is the point for the government to support a scheme that is not effective. We need a government issued national ID or make PASS hologram cards part of official identification here in England in order to solve this problem as carrying driving licences or passports is a big risk to take and a long process to replace

attributes.action: More effort to increase the peace process between Israel and Palestine
attributes.background: The UK Government should carry out a detailed review of all its efforts towards facilitating the peace process between Israel and Palestine. This review should identify what hasn’t been done and recommend new action that the Government could take.
attributes.additional_details: For so long people have seen these two states as enemies and for too long innocent people have been brought into a conflict which deeply effects the progression of life in this area of the world. It is time for this to stop.

attributes.action: Allow Industrial Hemp to be grown without a Home Office License (4 plants)
attributes.background: I propose a registered scheme with local police to allow UK adults to grow 4 plants of Industrial Hemp ONLY at home without a Home Office License. With tested seeds that are below 0.2% THC. Allowing individuals to grow safe CBD Hemp at home for personal use only . With labelled & tagged plants.
attributes.additional_details:
Iskedjian et al. Meta-analysis of cannabis based treatments for neuropathic and multiple sclerosis-related pain. Curr Med Res Opin. 23(1):17-24.(2007).
 Bergamaschi et al. Safety and side effects of cannabidiol, a Cannabis sativa constituent. Curr Drug Saf. 2011 Sep 1;6(4):237-49.

The fact there has never been a single recorded case of a death caused by CBD or even a psychotic episode caused by CBD . I am in no way endorsing Recreational Cannabis , but urging you to consider this alternative.

attributes.action: Protection for WW2 RN wrecks that are being blown up & the sailors desecrated
attributes.background:
Royal navy wrecks from ww2 are at risk of being blown up for scrap metal in south East Asia.
Dutch wrecks have simply disappeared.
Our dead saliors have a claim on us to protect them in death as they protected us in life.

No WW2 Royal Navy battleships are preserved. We risk losing them forever
attributes.additional_details:
Everything I have said in the background information is able to be checked in Google and I have come across information in the media, see link below
https://www.theguardian.com/world/ng-interactive/2017/nov/03/worlds-biggest-grave-robbery-asias-disappearing-ww2-shipwrecks
